item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, September 6, 2024 at 9:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Did Sandia use a thermonuclear secondary in a product logo? (117 points | 13 comments)
2. What happens when you touch a pickle to an AM radio tower (88 points | 27 comments)
3. Exercise has 2M users but no money in the bank (32 points | 24 comments)
4. Mozilla introduces updates to tab management in Firefox (14 points | 8 comments)

6. UE5 Nanite in WebGPU (323 points | 94 comments)
7. The expected value of the game is positive regardless of Ballmer’s strategy (126 points | 94 comments)
8. Phind-405B and faster, high quality AI answers for everyone (264 points | 112 comments)
9. Baseline pupil size related to cognitive ability in proper lighting conditions (40 points | 51 comments)
10. AlphaProteo generates novel proteins for biology and health research (264 points | 88 comments)
11. The origins of the steam engine (2023) (51 points | 7 comments)
12. Speeding up Electron apps by using V8 snapshots in the main process (36 points | 27 comments)
13. Oxford commercializes its 20% more powerful solar panels in the US (13 points | 5 comments)
14. Deploying rust in existing firmware codebases (147 points | 81 comments)
15. Summing Blue Noise Octaves Like Perlin Noise (10 points | 1 comment)

20. Cron Jobs on Linux – Comprehensive Guide with Examples (42 points | 16 comments)

22. Common food dye found to make skin and muscle temporarily transparent (216 points | 79 comments)
23. Show HN: AnythingLLM – Open-Source, All-in-One Desktop AI Assistant (250 points | 62 comments)
24. Clojure 1.12.0 is now available (256 points | 49 comments)
25. The 'Freakish Radio Writings' of 1924 (56 points | 6 comments)
26. The work you do, the person you are (2017) (44 points | 18 comments)
27. Frustrations with the OCaml ecosystem while developing a synthesizer library (35 points | 7 comments)
28. Apache Zeppelin (115 points | 28 comments)
29. Trellis (YC W24) is hiring eng to build AI workflows for unstructured data ( | hide)
